page.title: 12St.Barnabas Church,Stock
page.content: In 1884 the little church was completely rebuilt exactly as it used to be.As it stands right next to the big house the then Squire decided to use it more as a private chapel and built a small hutted church for the parishioners in Kingstag. The intriguing thing about the church is that there are two memorials,chronologically separated by some 650 years but linked. The first is that of Igleramus de Wallace who is believed to have founded the little church and whose tomb shows him to have been a crusader. The second is to Captain Farr Yeatman who died outside Jerusalem in 1917.
